title: "There are" (Yparxoun).
reading_greek: Στο σπίτι υπάρχουν πολλά δωμάτια. Υπάρχουν δύο καρέκλες και ένα τραπέζι. Δεν υπάρχουν γάτες. Υπάρχουν μόνο βιβλία.
reading_english: In the house there are many rooms. There are two chairs and one table. There are no cats. There are only books.
audio_script: Welcome to Week 4 of your Greek course. Today we learn the crucial phrase, 'There are'... which is 'Υπάρχουν' (Yparxoun). This phrase is used when talking about multiple items existing in a place. If you want to say 'There are not', you simply add the negative particle 'Δεν' (Den) before it: 'Δεν υπάρχουν' (Den Yparxoun). ... Let's practice with a short text about what is in a house. Listen carefully, paying attention to the pronunciation of 'Υπάρχουν'. ... Στο σπίτι υπάρχουν πολλά δωμάτια. Υπάρχουν δύο καρέκλες και ένα τραπέζι. Δεν υπάρχουν γάτες. Υπάρχουν μόνο βιβλία. ... Now, let's break that down. 'In the house there are many rooms.' 'There are two chairs and one table.' 'There are no cats.' 'There are only books.' ... Great job. Now, repeat the key phrase after me: 'Υπάρχουν'. ... 'Δεν υπάρχουν'.
